channel.title: NOT IN on Alessandro Lacava
channel.description: Recent content in NOT IN on Alessandro Lacava

item.title: NOT IN vs. NOT EXISTS when NULL values are involved
item.description: NOT IN does not behave as you would expect when NULL values are involved. Suppose you have the following tables: Now try the following query: SELECT * FROM table_a a WHERE a.cd_field NOT IN (SELECT b.cd_field FROM table_b b); Does the previous query return any row? The answer is NO it doesn’t, even if there is a value (2) in table_a.cd_field which is not present in table_b.cd_field. I think this is because NOT IN internally uses the inequality operator.
